data.text:
The question "how old was Winona Ryder in Edward Scissorhands" refers to the age of the actress Winona Ryder when she played the role of Kim Boggs in the 1990 film Edward Scissorhands.

This question is commonly asked because Ryder was relatively young when she played the role, and her youthful appearance contributed to the character's vulnerability and innocence. At the time of filming, Ryder was just 19 years old, while her co-star Johnny Depp was 27. The age difference between the two actors helped to create a sense of tension and forbidden love in the film.

Ryder's performance in Edward Scissorhands was highly praised, and she was nominated for a Golden Globe Award for Best Actress in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy. The film was also a critical and commercial success, and it is now considered a classic.

The film tells the story of Edward (Johnny Depp), a young man with scissors for hands, who is created by a lonely inventor. Edward is taken in by a suburban family, but he is met with prejudice and fear from the community. Kim Boggs (Winona Ryder) is the only person who truly accepts Edward for who he is, and she helps him to find his place in the world.

The film's themes of acceptance and tolerance are timeless, and it remains a popular classic today. Ryder's performance as Kim Boggs is a key part of the film's success, and her age at the time of filming helped to make the character more relatable and sympathetic to audiences.
